title: Week 1: Base Building - Easy Runs
description: Focus on easy runs this week. 3-4 runs of 30-45 minutes each at a conversational pace. One longer run of 60 minutes.

title: Week 1: Strength Training
description: Light strength training: Squats, lunges, planks. 2 sets of 15 reps. Focus on form.

title: Week 2: Increase Mileage - Easy Runs
description: Increase total mileage slightly. 3-4 runs of 40-50 minutes each. One longer run of 75 minutes.

title: Week 2: Strength Training
description: Strength training: Add calf raises and hamstring curls to previous exercises. 2 sets of 15 reps.

title: Week 3: Introduction to Tempo Runs
description: Introduce a tempo run. Warm-up, 20 minutes at a comfortably hard pace, cool down. Plus 2-3 easy runs of 40-50 minutes and a long run of 90 minutes.

title: Week 3: Strength Training & Rest
description: Strength training: Increase weight or resistance. Focus on core stability. Rest day after.

title: Week 4: Increase Tempo and Long Run
description: Tempo run: Increase to 25 minutes. Easy runs: 3-4 of 45-60 minutes. Long run: 105 minutes.

title: Week 4: Strength Training & Rest
description: Strength training: Include exercises for glutes. Rest day after.

title: Week 5: Introduction to Interval Training
description: Interval training: 6 x 400m at a fast pace with equal recovery. Easy runs: 3-4 of 45-60 minutes. Long run: 120 minutes.

title: Week 5: Strength Training & Rest
description: Strength Training: Focus on explosive movements like jump squats. Rest Day after

title: Week 6: Increase Intervals and Long Run
description: Interval training: 8 x 400m or 4 x 800m. Easy runs: 3-4 of 45-60 minutes. Long run: 135 minutes.

title: Week 6: Strength Training & Rest
description: Strength Training: Increase intensity or resistance. Rest day after.

title: Week 7: Peak Long Run
description: Long run: 150 minutes. Continue with interval and tempo work.

title: Week 7: Rest and Recover
description: Focus on rest and recovery. Light stretching and foam rolling.

title: Week 8: Maintain Intensity, Reduce Volume
description: Maintain tempo and interval intensity, but reduce the number of repetitions and the length of the long run (120 minutes).

title: Week 8: Active Recovery
description: Focus on active recovery like light cycling or swimming.

title: Week 9: Taper Begins - Reduce Mileage
description: Reduce overall mileage by 20%. Keep one shorter tempo run.

title: Week 9: Light Strength Training
description: Very light strength training. Focus on maintenance.

title: Week 10: Further Mileage Reduction
description: Reduce mileage by another 20%. Easy runs only. Long run: 60 minutes easy.

title: Week 10: Rest
description: Complete rest day.

title: Week 11: Very Light Activity
description: Extremely light jogging only. No hard efforts. 20-30 minutes max.

title: Week 11: Final Rest Before Race
description: Complete rest before the race.

title: Week 12: Race Week!
description: Marathon Race Day. Ensure proper nutrition and hydration. Get plenty of sleep the nights leading up to the race.

title: Week 12: Post-Race Recovery
description: Active recovery - light walking. Focus on nutrition and hydration.
